SALEventSet.Enumeration: AxisState_Unknown=0, AxisState_Idle=1, AxisState_Enabled=2, AxisState_DiscreteMove=3, AxisState_JogMove=4, AxisState_Tracking=5, AxisState_Stopping=6, AxisState_Fault=7
DriveState_Unknown=0, DriveState_Off=1, DriveState_Moving=2, DriveState_Stopping=3, DriveState_Stopped=4, DriveState_Fault=5

SubsystemId_AzimuthAxis=100, SubsystemId_AzimuthDrive=200, SubsystemId_AzimuthCableWrap=300, SubsystemId_ElevationAxis=400, SubsystemId_ElevationDrive=500, SubsystemId_MainPowerSupply=600, SubsystemId_EncoderInterfaceBox=700, SubsystemId_OilSupplySystem=800, SubsystemId_MirrorCovers=900, SubsystemId_CameraCableWrap=1000, SubsystemId_Balance=1100, SubsystemId_DeployablePlatform=1200, SubsystemId_Cabinet=1300, SubsystemId_LockingPins=1400, SubsystemId_MirrorCoverLocks=1500, SubsystemId_AzimuthThermal=1600, SubsystemId_ElevationThermal=1700, SubsystemId_Interlock=1800, SubsystemId_TopEndChiller=2200

SALEvent.Description: Are the elevation and azimuth axes in position? If tracking, in position means the slew is done and the axes are now tracking the target.

item.Description: Is the elevation axis in position?
Is the azimuth axis in position?

SALEvent.Description: State of the elevation and azimuth axes.

item.Description: Elevation state, as an AxisState constant enum.
Azimuth state, as an AxisState constant enum.

SALEvent.Description: State of the camera cable wrap.

item.Description: State, as an AxisState constant enum.

SALEvent.Description: Is camera cable wrap following enabled?

item.Description: If true the camera cable wrap is trying to follow the rotator. If false that code is not running.
Target camera cable wrap position.
Target camera cable wrap velocity.
TAI date at which the commanded positions and velocities apply, as unix time.

SALEvent.Description: State of TCP/IP connection to the low level controller (the "operations manager").

item.Description: Is the command (client) socket connected (true=yes, false=no)?
Is the replies (server) socket connected (true=yes, false=no)?
Is the error condition latched on (as it been active since it was last reset)?
Is the error condition present?
Error identifier code.
Text description of error.
Subsystem that produced the error; a single SubsystemId enumeration value.
Target mount elevation angle at the specified time.
Target mount elevation angle velocity at the specified time.
Target mount azimuth angle at the specified time. The allowed range is 0 to 360.
Target mount azimuth velocity at the specified time.
TAI date at which the commanded positions and velocities apply, as unix time.
Unique target identifier.
Defines tracking coordinate system as sidereal, non-sidereal or local.
Coordinate reference frame of RA/DEC axes. This originates from the pointing component and is used for WCS definition (e.g. FK5 or ICRS).
Is the warning condition present?
Warning identifier code.
Text description of warning.
Subsystem that produced the warning; a single SubsystemId enumeration value.
